security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution. The skill is a conversational framework for scientific brainstorming.

content.user_title: Generate research hypotheses with an ideation partner
content.value_statement: Scientists need fresh research directions but often get stuck in established thinking patterns. This skill acts as a collaborative ideation partner to generate hypotheses, explore unexpected interdisciplinary connections, and develop innovative methodologies through structured brainstorming techniques.
actual_capabilities: Generate novel research hypotheses through guided ideation sessions
Apply structured techniques like SCAMPER, Six Thinking Hats, and Morphological Analysis
Explore interdisciplinary connections and cross-domain analogies
Challenge assumptions and identify research gaps
Develop experimental designs and methodological approaches
Synthesize ideas into concrete research directions
limitations: Does not access external databases or literature APIs
Cannot verify hypotheses against real scientific data
Does not write or execute code for experiments
No access to the user's files or research data

use_cases.title: Academic research ideation
use_cases.description: Graduate students and professors seeking novel research directions and grant proposals

use_cases.title: Innovation brainstorming
use_cases.description: R&D teams exploring new product directions and technology applications

use_cases.title: Thesis development
use_cases.description: Doctoral candidates developing research questions and experimental frameworks

prompt_templates.title: Basic hypothesis request
prompt_templates.prompt: I am working on [research topic]. Can you help me brainstorm novel hypotheses by exploring connections to [related field] and applying the SCAMPER framework?

prompt_templates.title: Assumption challenge
prompt_templates.prompt: Challenge my assumptions about [current research approach]. What if we reversed the fundamental premise? Use Six Thinking Hats to explore this from multiple perspectives.

prompt_templates.title: Interdisciplinary connection
prompt_templates.prompt: How might principles from [field A] apply to my problem in [field B]? Use biomimicry or TRIZ principles to suggest innovative approaches.

prompt_templates.title: Methodology design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design experiments to test [hypothesis]. Apply morphological analysis to map out all possible methodological combinations we could explore.

output_examples.input: I'm studying antibiotic resistance in bacteria and need new research directions
output: Potential interdisciplinary connection: Apply network theory from epidemiology to model resistance gene spread
Cross-domain analogy: Immune system memory mechanisms could inspire new treatment timing strategies
SCAMPER suggestion: Substitute traditional culture methods with microfluidic single-cell analysis
Hypothesis: Bacterial persistence states may share mechanisms with viral latency

best_practices: Start by explaining your research context in detail including constraints and obstacles
Be specific about your field and what has already been tried
Ask for particular techniques like SCAMPER or TRIZ when you want structured exploration
Take breaks between sessions to let ideas incubate before continuing
anti_patterns: Using the skill to replace literature review rather than complement it
Expecting fully formed research projects without additional refinement
Accepting all generated ideas without critical evaluation
Skipping the understanding phase and jumping directly to hypothesis generation

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude models?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires conversational reasoning capabilities.

faq.question: What brainstorming techniques are included?
faq.answer: SCAMPER, Six Thinking Hats, Morphological Analysis, TRIZ, Biomimicry, Provocation, and Random Input techniques.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my research workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, use the output as a starting point for literature review and experimental design. Export ideas to your preferred research tool.

faq.question: Is my research data secure?
faq.answer: The skill does not access your files or store data. Only information you share in the conversation is processed temporarily.

faq.question: What if the ideas seem unrealistic?
faq.answer: The divergent phase generates many ideas intentionally. Use the critical evaluation phase to assess feasibility and refine promising concepts.

faq.question: How is this different from general brainstorming?
faq.answer: This skill uses scientifically-validated frameworks like TRIZ and Morphological Analysis specifically adapted for research contexts.
